posts.post_content:
T216 Dave Shean. Toughest of the (3) Kotton type T216s, the "Never Go Out" variety, like the T216 Virginia Extra type, was printed on a significantly thinner stock than the other T216 types (Kotton Tobacco, Kotton Extra Mild, and Mino) with the consequence that most surviving examples are found in poor or "authentic" condition. This Shean is the best example I have seen of the type. 

Graded SGC 45 (3.5), the card presents very nicely with moderate edge wear and a light wet sheet transfer on an otherwise clean back.

[STRIKE]$600[/STRIKE] $525

Very cool card!

Sent from my SM-G900V using Tapatalk

Very cool indeed
